author:
Debbie Holmes 

Trail-Gazette
title: Estes runners capture league titles
text:
Estes runners capture league titles Boys finish second overall, girls place third By Debbie Holmes Posted: 10/14/2015 09:09:08 AM MDT Click photo to enlarge Estes Park's Dylan Zurfluh led all boy runners, capturing first place at Saturday's Patriot League Championship in Kersey. « 2 » 
Estes Park runners Dylan Zurfluh and Lily Tomasula-Martin took home the Patriot League individual champion titles at Saturday's Patriot League Championship cross country meet in Kersey. 
Zurfluh grabbed the one-second victory over hometown favorite Andrew King from Platte Valley. Martin finished with a minute and half over second place finisher Emma Willadsen from Eaton. 
Scoring for the Bobcats were first place finisher Dylan Zurfluh (17:13), Finn Tierney, (fourth, 17:55), Cobi Lasota, (12th, 18:12), Mason Ginter (19th, 18:35), Josh Bradford, (25th, 18:54), Eric Todd, (28th, 19:00) and Harrison Daley, (34th, 19:19). 
The Estes Park boys team finished second as a team with 61 points, behind Patriot League team champions Frontier Academy who scored only 59. The boys had the overall top average team time clocking in at 18:09 where the Frontier Academy runners averaged 18:11. 
Also running for the Bobcats were; Chase Schwarz (19:47), Zach Schwarz (20:28), Austin Park (20:29), Rhett Dacaug (21:05), Oliver Moreau (21:06), Bradley Jensen (21:19), Sean Grosser (22:27), Blake Murray (23:50) and Zach Ostrich (31:22). 
The Ladycats finished third overall as a team with 70 points, behind Patriot League team Champions Frontier Academy who scored 49 points and Eaton High School who scored 59. Average team time of the Ladycat top finishers was 21:58. Eaton runners averaged 21:56 and Frontier Academy 21:53. Advertisement 
Scoring for Estes included Lily Tomasula-Martin's first-place finish (18:46), Emma Laurienti (11th, 22:07), Janet Rojas (18th, 22:45), Madison Beesley (21st, 23:04), Reanna Monroe (23rd, 23:12), Simone Paul (24th, 23:14) and Josie Christenson (26th, 23:31). 
Completing the Ladycat roster were; Carlie Rosenkrance (23:32), Annalise Basch (23:40), Skylar Shumate (23:50), Mae Tice (24:58), Piper Lasota (25:08) Anya Igel (26:34), Olivia Reins (26:35), Andra McDougall (27:38). 
The Estes cross country team will enjoy a well-deserved weekend off from competition as it prepares for the regional championships, which will take place in Greeley on Oct. 22.
